name: Bank Migration and Meander
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: Compares meander migration rates and cutoff frequency to reference behavior; excessive migration or avulsions indicate instability.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compare historic aerials; digitize centerlines or bank edges when possible to measure lateral movement; otherwise use qualitative evidence of bend migration, cutoffs, and oxbows; compare to reference reaches.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Very rapid migration, avulsions, or channel jumps.
Criteria: Frequent or large cutoffs; path strongly out of character for setting.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Noticeably accelerated migration or several cutoffs in recent decades.
Criteria: Migration about 2-3x reference or chute cutoffs common.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Slightly faster or constrained migration; occasional cutoffs.
Criteria: Minor departure from reference behavior.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Slow, natural bend movement matches nearby reference.
Criteria: Cutoffs rare; migration rate near reference.
